page.title: 18WEATHER LORE
page.content:
If Christmas Day on Thursday be A windy winter we shall see The summer will be warm and dry And beasts and fruit will multiply.
- A mild Christmas gives a full churchyard.
- If the sun shines through the apple trees on Christmas Day there should be a good crop of apples.
- When Candlemas Day is come and gone The snow will lie on a hot stone.
- In spring, the north wind will stay till the blackthorn is out.
- Three white frosts produce rain.
- If the sheep are on the top of Clunbury Hill it will be a fine day.
